page.title: 19SHOPS IN HESSLE SQUARE
page.content: Hessle Square is the main shopping centre in this area. It has the largest number of shops, including two supermarkets, two chemists, one garage, one big newsagency, two public houses and one camera shop, plus many other smaller shops. Hundreds of local people use the Square for their routine shopping. On Saturdays, particularly, it is very busy. Recently, however, Prestongate has been made into a "pedestrian only" street. Some of the traders have been objecting to this, saying the lack of car-parking in the area is affecting people's shopping habits. Certainly, the opening of a large supermarket (Sainsbury's) on the outskirts of the village has attracted many local shoppers, perhaps because of its own large car-park and because the shop is well-stocked and attractive.
